intro: Ranunculus callianthus, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Mediterranean region. It features delicate, cup-shaped flowers with bright yellow petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
